body.head.byline: By VIVIAN S. TOY; With Elsa Brenner, Suzanne Hamlin and Antoinette Martin

abstract.p: Sampling of housing on market in New York City metropolitan area; photos (M)

block.p: East Harlem Duplex $1,995,000
MANHATTAN: 236 East 111th Street (between Second and Third Aves.), #1

A one-bedroom, two-bath condo with central air-conditioning, fireplace, laundry room, office, dressing room, basement and roof deck. Dorothy Schrager, Warburg Realty (212) 300-1822; www.warburgrealty.com
COMMON CHARGE: $600 a month; taxes: $420 a month

PROS: Set in the lower two floors of a onetime farmhouse later used as a church, the unit has design treats including a hidden door connecting the kitchen and living room and a retractable screen for movies.
CONS: The unit's roof deck can be reached only by going through the upstairs apartment.
Eastern Parkway Co-op $485,000
BROOKLYN: 358 Eastern Parkway (near Franklin Avenue), #8

A pet-friendly two-bedroom, two-bath apartment with roof rights, on the fourth floor of an eight-unit prewar building. Paul LeMarc Brown, the Corcoran Group (212) 500-7037; www.corcoran.com.Open house Sunday, 11:30 a.m.-1:30 p.m.
MAINTENANCE: $590 a month
PROS: The building is near subways and a short walk to Prospect Park. Board approval is not required for this recently renovated unit.
CONS: The building has no elevator; the second bedroom is small.
Chelsea Duplex $815,000
MANHATTAN: 426 West 23rd Street (between Ninth and Tenth Avenues), #1F
A one-bedroom, one-and-a-half-bath co-op with a fireplace and washer and dryer. Chazz Levi (212) 893-1458, Noble Black (212) 605-9223, the Corcoran Group; www.corcoran.com
MAINTENANCE: $1,018 a month
PROS: The lower level has a charming grottolike sitting area.
CONS: The bedroom is a bit dark since it is below ground.
Montclair Walk-Up $349,500
NEW JERSEY: 515 Bloomfield Avenue, #2D

A two-bedroom, two-bath condominium in a 1913 building in the heart of Montclair with high ceilings, oversize windows, hardwood floors, a renovated kitchen and a laundry/work room. Linda Grotenstein, Coldwell Banker Realtors (973) 783-5100; www.coldwellbanker.com
TAXES: $5,284 a year; common charge: $366 a month

PROS: This second-floor apartment in Montclair's shopping district, around the corner from the Y.M.C.A., seems to be a Manhattan transplant, but at a fraction of the price. Garage parking for one car is included.
CONS: The bathrooms are vintage, and the busy street may not be to everyone's taste.
Colonial With Fairway Views $899,000
WESTCHESTER: 4 Old Road, Elmsford

A two-story brick colonial built in 1989 with four bedrooms, three baths and a two-car attached garage, on a half-acre lot overlooking Knollwood Country Club. Andrew Silfen, Houlihan Lawrence (914) 844-0007; www.houlihanlawrence.com
TAXES: $18,621 a year
PROS: The house has large, light-filled rooms and central air-conditioning. An enclosed breezeway with washer and dryer offers plenty of room for storage.
CONS: The kitchen and bathrooms could use updating.
